summary: This is a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney Laura A. Menninger to Judge Loretta A. Preska, filed in a civil case. It requests a temporary stay of the unsealing process due to new information obtained in the parallel criminal case, discusses proposed modifications to streamline unsealing, and lists five motions proposed for the next round of unsealing review.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of both the civil action (15 Civ. 7433) and the criminal action (20 Cr. 330). Her counsel is requesting a stay of the unsealing process based on new information.

persons.name: Loretta A. Preska
persons.context: The judge presiding over the civil case to whom this letter is addressed, regarding the unsealing order and protocol.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman representing Ghislaine Maxwell. She authored this letter to the court.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the parallel criminal case (U.S. v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330). A protective order from that case restricts the use of new information.

persons.name: Sharon Churcher
persons.context: A non-party who filed a motion to quash a subpoena. One of the five motions proposed for the next unsealing review.

persons.name: Doe 1
persons.context: A non-party whose deposition is subject to a stay by the Second Circuit. Counsel has obtained new contact information for this individual.

connections.description: Menninger is defense counsel representing Maxwell in the civil case, as stated in the letterhead and throughout the document.
Preska is the presiding judge over the civil case in which Maxwell is a defendant.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the parallel criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery of New Information
events.description: Counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell learned of critical new information impacting both the civil and criminal cases, implicating her due process rights.

events.title: Court Order on Unsealing
events.description: Judge Preska issued an order (Doc. 1069) related to the unsealing process, which this letter is responding to.

events.title: Unsealing Order
events.description: The court issued an unsealing order which is under review by the Second Circuit.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY 10007
Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., 150 East 10th Avenue, Denver, Colorado 80203
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel obtained new, critical information on August 7, 2020, but cannot disclose it due to a protective order in the parallel criminal case.
Maxwell's counsel is requesting a temporary three-week stay of the unsealing process to resolve issues related to sharing the new information with the civil court and the Second Circuit.
The parties agreed to notify all non-parties at once regarding unsealing to gauge objections, but anticipate significant effort to prepare individualized excerpts.
Five specific motions are proposed for the next round of unsealing review, selected because they contain sealed material but do not quote from depositions under a Second Circuit stay.
Counsel notes they have obtained new contact information for 'Doe 1' from a separate civil suit and believe this individual retains notification rights.
